ddb-importer.image-upload-directory.name: Avatar upload directory
ddb-importer.image-upload-directory.hint: Specificies the avatar upload location on the server.
ddb-importer.scene-upload-directory.name: Scene upload directory
ddb-importer.scene-upload-directory.hint: Specificies the scene upload location on the server.
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.name: Compendium import policy (GM only)
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.hint: Defines if imported items should be saved into the compendiums below, and under which circumstances.
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.0: Save all entities, overwrite existing ones
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.1: Save new entities only, do not overwrite existing ones
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.2: Do not save the entities at all
ddb-importer.entity-cleanup-policy.name: Cleaning policy
ddb-importer.entity-cleanup-policy.hint: When saving imports to compendiums, you can decide if you want to clean up the entities from the current world or keep them
ddb-importer.entity-cleanup-policy.0: Keep all entities in the world
ddb-importer.entity-item-compendium.name: Item compendium
ddb-importer.entity-monster-feature-comp: Target compendium for imported monster features
ddb-importer.log-level.name: Log Level
ddb-importer.log-level.hint: The level of console log statements that should be displayed in the console.
ddb-importer.scene-format.name: Scene image format
ddb-importer.scene-format.hint: Sets the scene image format. WEBP is recommended due to smaller file size and faster loading speeds.
ddb-importer.cobalt-cookie.name: DDB Cobalt Cookie
ddb-importer.cobalt-cookie.hint: You can get this using my Chrome extension
